In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` that performs the specified cleaning on column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return lowercase(strip(col)) * "_"  # Replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
end
```

This function first lowers the case of the input string using `lowercase`, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`. Finally, it appends an underscore to replace any spaces and hyphens that may have been present in the original column name.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will return "my_column", which is what you expect after applying all the transformations.
